page.title: 10Growing Cress & Commonland
page.content: {Gade Spring Cress This business was started in 1860 around 20 years before the canal was built.The beds used to be on both sides of the canal but now they are only on one side of the canal.The cress is packed in unweighed bundles that are harvested in April/May.After pavking in boxes they are sent to a London market.The present owners,Mr. Mills and Mr.Smith don't know how much they grow because it varies each year. {Boxmoor Common The fields we were examining are on the A41 and they are either side of Old Fishery Lane.Field 1:18 trees, 1 water trough,1 old railway tunnel. Field 2:30 trees,25 cows and 1 water trough.
